Lonely #14 B, Mo and Steph

Posted on April 7, 2012 by mike

So, I posted Mo on the previous entry since she’s always been such an inspiration and “gamer” for my ideas! And, another friend of hers and mine, Steph, falls in that same category. Thus, once the formal “Lonely Roads” shooting began, both of these lovely ladies agreed to partake in the project with me during my April 2008 visit to the Gorge.Â Holy Canoli. NowÂ you get to see Mo “back to back” inÂ  two entries. Or is it “front to back” …or “front to front”. Hmmm…options! ðŸ™‚

Well…the shoot was guided again by Scott Cook, my buddy, who will also show up on entry #14 C as the voice/videographer! Scott is an accomplished writer and photographer and he knew a fabulous place to take the 3 of us that day where we’d get epic sunset lighting, a majestic view of the Columbia, and privacy! …..Almost. LOL. Guess he didn’t plan on that sexy motorcycle guy driving up to us. And, would you imagine, after being shocked by the gorgeous nude women standing there draped in fabric, the guy ended up marrying one of them! Well..not quite…maybe I have the order of things mixed up. Butt, Â that’s what I’ll go with for this story.

The location for thisÂ shoot was actually on the WA side of the Columbia River across from Hood River, OR,Â near the townÂ of Bingen.Â TheÂ unique angled rock formation you’ll see inÂ the video (next entry) is referred to as theÂ “Sincline”,Â I think. And, with Easter Sunday happeningÂ tomorrow…and I wonderÂ if that holds some strange meaning for me? Should I go to church?? Anyway,Â Steph and Mo used fabrics and fur and motion and their stunning selves to create images and memories I treasure! It was so damn fun. Well, check the attached pictures out. And, on Page 26 of “The Lonely Road” book, you’ll see another image from this shoot taken right as the sun was going down over that beautiful river made famous by Lewis & Clark. It’s a really cool image of the gals jumping…..but you’ll have to buy my book to see it. Hint, hint.
